text.quote: 1: Clause 1, page 1, line 3, after first “peerage” insert “or baronetcy”
2: Clause 1, page 1, line 3, after first “peerage” insert “or baronetcy, or other heritable office of the Crown or State,”
3*: Clause 1, line 1, after “baronetcy,” insert “or bearers of arms,”
4: Clause 1, page 1, line 3, after “Scotland,” insert “Ireland,”
5: Clause 1, page 1, line 6, after first “peerage” insert “or baronetcy”
6: Clause 1, page 1, line 6, leave out “(“hereditary peerage”) or hereditary title” and insert “(“hereditary title”)”
7: Clause 1, page 1, line 6, after second “peerage” insert “or baronetcy”
8: Clause 1, page 1, line 6, leave out “hereditary title”
9: Clause 1, page 1, line 6, leave out “hereditary title” and insert “baronetcy or other heritable office of the Crown or State”
10: Clause 1, page 1, line 6, leave out from “title” to end of line 7 and insert “will be succeeded by a living heir regardless of gender on the death of the present incumbent”
11*: Clause 1, line 2, after “heir” insert “which, in Scotland, shall include any child born to the incumbent and legitimised by marriage,”
12: Clause 1, page 1, line 6, leave out “may” and insert “shall”
13: Clause 1, page 1, line 7, at end insert—

“( ) Once succession has passed to a female heir, thereafter the succession shall be in terms of the destination or limitation of the title, but with the succession being traced without reference to gender.”
14: After Clause 1, insert the following new Clause—
“Definition of female heir
(1) For the purposes of this Act “female heir” includes a daughter conceived through the use of the gametes of both the incumbent and his wife but carried by a surrogate mother.
(2) The Human Fertilisation and Embryology Act 2008 is amended as follows.
(3) After section 48(7) (effect of sections 33 to 47) insert—

“(7A) A daughter conceived through the use of the gametes of both an incumbent, to any dignity or title of honour, and his wife will be regarded as a legitimate female heir to the dignity or title of honour regardless of whether the pregnancy was carried by a surrogate mother or the wife.””
15: Clause 2, page 1, line 10, leave out “hereditary peerage or”
16: Clause 2, page 1, line 10, leave out “hereditary title” and insert “baronetcy”
17: Clause 2, page 1, line 10, leave out “hereditary title” and insert “baronetcy or other heritable office of the Crown or State”
18: Clause 2, page 1, line 15, leave out “hereditary peerage or”
19: Clause 2, page 1, line 15, leave out “hereditary title” and insert “baronetcy”
20: Clause 2, page 1, line 15, leave out “hereditary title” and insert “baronetcy or other heritable office of the Crown or State”
21: Clause 2, page 1, line 17, leave out sub-paragraph (i)
22: Clause 2, page 1, line 19, at end insert “or legitimated by subsequent marriage for the purpose of Scottish titles”
23*: Clause 2, page 1, line 19, at end insert “; or
text.IndentTwo: (iii) in Scotland, has satisfied the Lord Chancellor that she is the oldest surviving child born to the incumbent and legitimised by marriage”

text.quote: 24: Clause 2, page 1, line 19, at end insert “; or
text.IndentOne: ( ) where a hereditary peerage is without a male heir, that peerage should automatically pass to the incumbent’s oldest surviving daughter upon the incumbent’s death and should thereafter pass to the oldest surviving child regardless of gender”

text.quote: 25: Clause 2, page 1, line 19, at end insert—
text.IndentOne: “( ) that there is no Heir Apparent living at the date of the passing of this Act and at the date of death of the incumbent”

text.quote: 000: Clause 2, the above-named Lords give notice of their intention to oppose the Question that Clause 2 stand part of the Bill.

27*: Clause 3, page 2, line 6, at end insert—
“( ) Any child under the age of majority who is covered by subsection (1) shall have an independent guardian appointed by the Lord Chancellor.”

“(4) No petition under section 2 may be made in respect of any person living at the time this Act is passed.”
000: Clause 3, the above-named Lords give notice of their intention to oppose the Question that Clause 3 stand part of the Bill.

44: Clause 4, page 2, line 39, leave out “title” and insert “baronetcy”
45: Clause 4, page 2, line 39, leave out “title” and insert “baronetcy or other heritable office of the Crown or State”
46: Clause 4, leave out Clause 4 and insert the following new Clause—
“Petitioning procedure
(1) The petition procedure set out in section 3 shall only apply if all relevant people have notified the Lord Chancellor in writing of their agreement for the petition to be presented.
(2) A relevant person under subsection (1) shall be defined as—
text.IndentOne: (a) any sibling, child or descendant of the incumbent who could reasonably consider themselves in line to the title, or
(b) any person who is able to satisfy the Lord Chancellor that they have a reasonable expectation of succeeding to the title.
text.quote: (3) The Lord Chancellor shall publish his decision within six months of a petition being lodged.
(4) The Lord Chancellor’s assessment of a relevant person is final and is not subject to a right of appeal.”
000: Clause 4, the above-named Lords give notice of their intention to oppose the Question that Clause 4 stand part of the Bill.
47*: Clause 5, page 3, line 23, leave out paragraph (c)
48: Clause 5, page 3, line 23, leave out “offices,”
49: Clause 5, page 3, line 28, at end insert “(and where such property is in trust, the trustees shall have the power to alter the beneficiaries in order to achieve this)”
50: Clause 5, page 3, line 28, at end insert—
text.IndentOne: “(e) have all right or interest in any office descended on the same destination as the title”

text.quote: 51: Clause 5, page 3, line 28, at end insert—

“( ) For the avoidance of doubt, where no direct heirs to a hereditary peerage or baronetcy exist, succession shall continue according to the limitation or destination, but with the succession being traced without reference to gender.”
52: Clause 5, line 2, leave out “peerage or baronetcy” and insert “title”
53: Clause 6, page 3, line 31, after “title” insert “which is not a hereditary peerage”

70: Clause 7, page 4, line 2, at end insert—
“(2A) Nothing in this Act shall apply automatically to any person living at the time this Act is passed.
(2B) Any person covered by subsection (2A) who wishes part or all of this Act to apply to them may opt-in to the relevant provisions by notifying the Lord Chancellor in writing.
(2C) The provisions of this Act shall apply automatically to any person born after this Act is passed.”
71: Clause 7, page 4, line 2, at end insert—
“( ) Nothing in this Act shall displace an heir apparent who is living at the time this Act is passed.”
72*: Clause 7, page 4, line 2, at end insert—
“( ) The doctrine of abeyance in England, Ireland and the United Kingdom shall be abolished from the date on which this Act is passed.”

“( ) Holders of a Scottish hereditary peerage may apply to the Lord Chancellor to resign their peerage for a regrant with a different special remainder.”

90: Clause 9, page 4, line 19, leave out ““The Honourable”” and insert “which is of equivalent rank”
91: After Clause 10, insert the following new Clause—
“Baronetcies
text.IndentOne: For the avoidance of doubt, the provisions of this Act do not extend to baronetcies.”
